alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Mason; McLean; Peoria; Schuyler; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 12 at 6:58PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Illinois. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Saturday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com

area.areaDesc: Fulton; Mason; McLean; Peoria; Schuyler; Tazewell; Woodford
